instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A @.56 A no POST,
threads.message:
Hi, I got this board, it was working fine, I just cleaned it with isopropilic alcohol and now it doesn´t turn on. I get .56A at my PSU but no chime, image or POST. I have all the voltages present even <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> but I get nothing... should I reprogram the BIOS? This is so weird, it was working just fine, and after I cleaned, it just won´t start...
I have no USB activity and it is stuck at .56 A this board usually goes up to .80 a and then down to .40-50 but it usually doesn´t stops at a constant consumption, please help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A @.56 A no POST,
threads.message:
Check for knocked off components and damaged solders, traces.
Was the board affected by liquid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A @.56 A no POST,
threads.message:
No liquid damage, the board is turning on but not posting, SPI termination resistors are good...  pch clock is good, what else to check?
all voltages present, when I remove the SSD PSU gets to .44 A green and orange light on the charger...  cpu gets warm...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A @.56 A no POST,
threads.message:
Something got damaged when you've cleaned the board.
Still suspect broken trace, or moved component.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> stays high?
Try known good BIOS, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A @.56 A no POST,
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is present and stable. I´ve already tried a known good bios from the forum... speaker connected and not getting any sound from it either..l

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A @.56 A no POST,
threads.message: Which areas did you clean with IPA?
